main event: A civilian observer spotted an object with a flame-like appearance that moved erratically across the horizon in Downers Grove, Illinois in 1967.
interesting points: The object had a short, jerky, erratic motion across the horizon in approximately 20 seconds or less.
The object resembled a flame and was about the size of a coin at arm's length.
The observer reported that the object disappeared at the horizon.
The sighting lasted for 30 seconds or less.
The observer did not take any photographs and reported no physical evidence.
